title: (x) "Modern The World" Art Nouveau-ish serf face - hand drawn {Stephen}
content:
I’ve been searching. A few Scriptorium fonts are close, but no cigar.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [moderntheworld.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906163414/http:/typophile.com/files/moderntheworld.jpg) | 14.67 KB |

 [‹ (x) Upright script w/ curly swashes - Fling {Marcelo}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906163414/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40038 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Modern serif and gothic sans - Filosofia, Benton Sans {Brandon S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906163414/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40039 "Go to next forum topic")
author: juno10

comments.content: This is most likely hand drawn. Notice that each letter is unique.
And just clarity’s sake, isn’t this Art Nouveau, rather than Art Deco?

LHF Victoria has a similar feel, although the details are wildly different:  
 [http://www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/victoria.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906163414/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/victoria.shtml "http://www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/victoria.shtml")
P22’s [Salon Full](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906163414/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/salon.html) also has a similar feel.

I also think this owe’s something to the type that Dave Nalle’s [’Abaddon’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906163414/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/abaddon/) was modeled after, which was drawn by Alex Jay as an Art Nouveau-like face for a book about Dinosaurs by William Stout in 1981. Jay says his lettering was inspired by the work of Alphonse Mucha, one of the greats of the Art Nouveau movement.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks all, yes I meant to say art nouveau — I’d been searching fonts for so long my keywords were keywording themselves.

Abaddon was my jumping off point when I was searching for something similar. Looks like it’ll be a calligraphy project and not an Adobe Illustrator one.
